title.narrative: 07-2 GOVERNMENT DELIVERS SOCIAL PROT

description.narrative: 7.1.4 The Government of Zambia has the capacity to deliver an integrated set of child-, gender-, and HIV-sensitive social protection measures by 2015, which contributes to Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2015, the Government of Zambia has an improved policy environment and systems to reduce multidimensional child poverty and exclusion

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 7.1.4 The Government of Zambia has the capacity to deliver an integrated set of child-, gender-, and HIV-sensitive socialprotection measures by 2015
Number of recipients and beneficiary children in targeted extremely poor districts receiving monthly cash transfer payments

actual.value: 2015:200,000 recipients (December 2015) and an estimated 800,000 benefitting children

title.narrative: Dissemination of research findings from social cash transfer programme impact evaluations

actual.value: 2015:4 RCT impact evaluation reports released, 2 RCT reports in final draft, 2 WISP reports released, 1 in final draft

title.narrative: Social protection policy adopted by cabinet in 2014
Coordinated and integrated social protection measures implemented.

actual.value: 2015:Coordination framework not yet strengthened though work under way
